title: Download Geographic Data on Various Topics Provided and Managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru
text: package provides R users new way access Peru’s official cartographic data various topics managed Spatial Data Infrastructure Peru.

title: Download Geographic Data on Various Topics Provided and Managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru
code: library(ggplot2) library(geoidep) #>  #> ── Welcome to geoidep ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ geoidep is a wrapper that allows you to download cartographic data for Peru from R. #> Currently, `geoidep` supports the following providers: #> ✔ Geobosque #> ✔ INEI #> ✔ Midagri #> ✔ Sernanp #> ℹ For more information, please use the `get_data_sources()` function.

title: Download Geographic Data on Various Topics Provided and Managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru
code: departaments <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) names(departaments) #> [1] "id"           "OBJECTID"     "CCDD"         "NOMBDEP"      "SHAPE_Length" #> [6] "SHAPE_Area"   "geom" # Display the first 10 rows of the data frame `departaments` head(departaments) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -79.45857 ymin: -17.28501 xmax: -70.80408 ymax: -2.986125 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   id OBJECTID CCDD   NOMBDEP SHAPE_Length SHAPE_Area #> 1  1        1   01  AMAZONAS    13.059047   3.199147 #> 2  2        2   02    ANCASH    11.788249   2.954697 #> 3  3        3   03  APURIMAC     7.730154   1.765933 #> 4  4        4   04  AREQUIPA    17.459435   5.330125 #> 5  5        5   05  AYACUCHO    17.127166   3.643705 #> 6  6        6   06 CAJAMARCA    12.540288   2.688386 #>                             geom #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.81399 -... #> 2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.64697 -... #> 3 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.74655 -... #> 4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-71.98109 -... #> 5 MULTIPOLYGON (((-74.34843 -... #> 6 MULTIPOLYGON (((-78.70034 -...

title: Download Geographic Data on Various Topics Provided and Managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru
code: ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = departaments) +   theme_minimal()

title: Authors and Citation
text: antony barja. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: barja (2024). geoidep: Download Geographic Data Various Topics Provided Managed Spatial Data Infrastructure Peru. R package version 0.1.0, https://geografo.pe/geoidep/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {geoidep: Download Geographic Data on Various Topics Provided and Managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure of Peru},   author = {antony barja},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://geografo.pe/geoidep/}, }

what: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: goal geoidep offers R users easy accessible way obtain official cartographic data various topics, society, transport, environment, agriculture, climate, among others. also includes information provided regional government entities technical-scientific institutions,managed Spatial Data Infrastructure Peru.

title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: can install development version geoidep like :
code: install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install("ambarja/geoidep")

title: Download Peruvian data managed by the Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) of the National Institute of Statistics and Informatics (INEI) of Peru
text: simple example download Peru’s official administrative boundaries: first 10 rows original data displayed :
code: library(geoidep) dep <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) head(dep) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -79.45857 ymin: -17.28501 xmax: -70.80408 ymax: -2.986125 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   id OBJECTID CCDD   NOMBDEP SHAPE_Length SHAPE_Area #> 1  1        1   01  AMAZONAS    13.059047   3.199147 #> 2  2        2   02    ANCASH    11.788249   2.954697 #> 3  3        3   03  APURIMAC     7.730154   1.765933 #> 4  4        4   04  AREQUIPA    17.459435   5.330125 #> 5  5        5   05  AYACUCHO    17.127166   3.643705 #> 6  6        6   06 CAJAMARCA    12.540288   2.688386 #>                             geom #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.81399 -... #> 2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.64697 -... #> 3 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.74655 -... #> 4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-71.98109 -... #> 5 MULTIPOLYGON (((-74.34843 -... #> 6 MULTIPOLYGON (((-78.70034 -...

title: Reading a csv containing IDEP resources — get_data
text: Reading csv containing IDEP resources

title: Reading a csv containing IDEP resources — get_data
code: get_data()

what: List providers, description, year and link — get_data_sources
title: List providers, description, year and link — get_data_sources
text: Metadata information

title: List providers, description, year and link — get_data_sources
code: get_data_sources()

title: List providers, description, year and link — get_data_sources
text: tibble object.

title: List providers, description, year and link — get_data_sources
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) get_data_sources() #> # A tibble: 13 × 7 #>    provider  category      layer       layer_can_be_actived admin_en year  link  #>    <chr>     <chr>         <chr>       <lgl>                <chr>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 INEI      General       Departamen… TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  2 INEI      General       Provinces   TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  3 INEI      General       Districts   TRUE                 Nationa… 2019  http… #>  4 Sernanp   Enviroment    Zona de Am… FALSE                Nationa… 2018  http… #>  5 Sernanp   Enviroment    Zonificaci… FALSE                Nationa… 2024  http… #>  6 Sernanp   Enviroment    Zonificaci… FALSE                Nationa… 2024  http… #>  7 Sernanp   Enviroment    Zonificaci… FALSE                Nationa… 2024  http… #>  8 Midagri   Agriculture   Vegetation… TRUE                 Ministr… 2018  http… #>  9 Midagri   Agriculture   Agricultur… TRUE                 Ministr… 2024  http… #> 10 Midagri   Agriculture   Oil palm a… TRUE                 Ministr… 2016… http… #> 11 Midagri   Institucional Experiment… TRUE                 Ministr… 2024  http… #> 12 Geobosque Forest        Forest and… TRUE                 Ministr… 2001… http… #> 13 Geobosque Forest        Early warn… TRUE                 Ministr… last… http… # }

what: Download the Departament limits of INEI — get_departaments
title: Download the Departament limits of INEI — get_departaments
text: function allows download latest version geometry ubigeos corresponding official political division departament boundaries Peru. information, can visit following page https://ide.inei.gob.pe/

title: Download the Departament limits of INEI — get_departaments
code: get_departaments(dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

title: Download the Departament limits of INEI — get_departaments
text: dsn Character. Output filename. missing, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message.

title: Download the Departament limits of INEI — get_departaments
text: sf tibble object.

title: Download the Departament limits of INEI — get_departaments
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) dep <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) head(dep) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -79.45857 ymin: -17.28501 xmax: -70.80408 ymax: -2.986125 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   id OBJECTID CCDD   NOMBDEP SHAPE_Length SHAPE_Area #> 1  1        1   01  AMAZONAS    13.059047   3.199147 #> 2  2        2   02    ANCASH    11.788249   2.954697 #> 3  3        3   03  APURIMAC     7.730154   1.765933 #> 4  4        4   04  AREQUIPA    17.459435   5.330125 #> 5  5        5   05  AYACUCHO    17.127166   3.643705 #> 6  6        6   06 CAJAMARCA    12.540288   2.688386 #>                             geom #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.81399 -... #> 2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-77.64697 -... #> 3 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.74655 -... #> 4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-71.98109 -... #> 5 MULTIPOLYGON (((-74.34843 -... #> 6 MULTIPOLYGON (((-78.70034 -... # }

title: Download the districts limits of INEI — get_districts
text: function allows download latest version geometry ubigeos corresponding official political division district boundaries Peru. information, can visit following page https://ide.inei.gob.pe/

title: Download the districts limits of INEI — get_districts
code: get_districts(dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

text: dsn Character. Output filename *.gpkg format. missing, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. Suppress bar progress. quiet Logical. Suppress info message.

title: Download the districts limits of INEI — get_districts
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) dist <- get_districts(show_progress = FALSE) head(dist) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 12 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -73.6546 ymin: -14.08649 xmax: -73.02175 ymax: -13.70798 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   id OBJECTID UBIGEO CCDD CCPP CCDI  NOMBDEP    NOMBPROV #> 1  1        1 030220   03   02   20 APURIMAC ANDAHUAYLAS #> 2  2        2 030415   03   04   15 APURIMAC    AYMARAES #> 3  3        3 030409   03   04   09 APURIMAC    AYMARAES #> 4  4        4 030214   03   02   14 APURIMAC ANDAHUAYLAS #> 5  5        5 030206   03   02   06 APURIMAC ANDAHUAYLAS #> 6  6        6 030404   03   04   04 APURIMAC    AYMARAES #>                   NOMBDIST     CAPITAL SHAPE_Length  SHAPE_Area #> 1      JOSE MARIA ARGUEDAS HUANCABAMBA    0.5703507 0.014648915 #> 2                   TINTAY      TINTAY    0.7063312 0.011908124 #> 3                    LUCRE       LUCRE    0.5536897 0.008678206 #> 4 SAN MIGUEL DE CHACCRAMPA  CHACCRAMPA    0.4027041 0.007104229 #> 5                  HUAYANA     HUAYANA    0.5634482 0.007974308 #> 6               CHAPIMARCA  CHAPIMARCA    0.6308316 0.017072690 #>                             geom #> 1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.37071 -... #> 2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.17529 -... #> 3 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.24364 -... #> 4 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.63057 -... #> 5 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.51096 -... #> 6 MULTIPOLYGON (((-73.04322 -... # }

what: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
text: function allows download deforestation alert information detected Geobosque polygon located Peru. details, please visit following website: https://geobosques.minam.gob.pe

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
code: get_early_warning(region, sf = TRUE, show_progress = TRUE)

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
text: region Character. Specifies unique geographical code interest. sf Logical. Indicates whether return data `sf` object. show_progress Logical. TRUE, shows progress bar download.

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
text: tibble sf object, depending value `sf`.

title: Download information on the latest deforestation alerts detected by Geobosque — get_early_warning
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) amazonas <- get_departaments(show_progress = FALSE) |> subset(NOMBDEP == "AMAZONAS") warning_point <- get_early_warning(region = amazonas, sf = TRUE, show_progress = FALSE) head(warning_point) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -78.11332 ymin: -4.87162 xmax: -78.06041 ymax: -4.869992 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   descrip                     geometry #>   <chr>                    <POINT [°]> #> 1 Warning points (-78.06068 -4.869992) #> 2 Warning points (-78.06041 -4.869992) #> 3 Warning points (-78.11332 -4.870535) #> 4 Warning points (-78.06339 -4.870806) #> 5 Warning points   (-78.0927 -4.87162) #> 6 Warning points  (-78.09243 -4.87162) # }

what: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
text: Geobosque API get deforestation hot-spots last week

title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
code: get_early_warning_link(type = NULL)

title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
text: type string. Select one following layer; warning_last_week

title: Geobosque API to get deforestation hot-spots for the last week — get_early_warning_link
text: string containing URL requested file.

what: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: function allows download ubigeos corresponding official political division district, province region boundaries Peru forest loss information. information, can visit following website: https://geobosques.minam.gob.pe

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
code: get_forest_loss_data(level = NULL, ubigeo = NULL, show_progress = TRUE)

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: level Character. Specifies official administrative division level interest. ubigeo Character. Specifies unique geographical code interest. show_progress Logical. Indicates whether display progress bar.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: tibble object.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data
text: Available layers : dist: 6-character ubigeo representing administrative boundaries district. prov: 4-character ubigeo representing administrative boundaries province. dep: 2-character ubigeo representing administrative boundaries region.

title: Download the forest and loss information from Geobosque — get_forest_loss_data

what: Geobosque API that returns data on forest stock, forest loss, forest loss by ranges for a given department, province and district. — get_geobosque_link
title: Geobosque API that returns data on forest stock, forest loss, forest loss by ranges for a given department, province and district. — get_geobosque_link
text: Geobosque API returns data forest stock, forest loss, forest loss ranges given department, province district.

title: Geobosque API that returns data on forest stock, forest loss, forest loss by ranges for a given department, province and district. — get_geobosque_link
code: get_geobosque_link(type = NULL)

title: Geobosque API that returns data on forest stock, forest loss, forest loss by ranges for a given department, province and district. — get_geobosque_link
text: type string. Select one following layers; 'bpdist', 'bppro', 'bpdep'. Defaults NULL.

title: Geobosque API that returns data on forest stock, forest loss, forest loss by ranges for a given department, province and district. — get_geobosque_link
text: string containing URL requested file.

what: Retrieve INEI Links of the Basic Cartographic Information — get_inei_link
title: Retrieve INEI Links of the Basic Cartographic Information — get_inei_link
text: Retrieve INEI Links Basic Cartographic Information

title: Retrieve INEI Links of the Basic Cartographic Information — get_inei_link
code: get_inei_link(type = NULL)

title: Retrieve INEI Links of the Basic Cartographic Information — get_inei_link
text: type string. Select one following layers; ‘districts’, ‘provinces’, ‘departments’. Defaults NULL.

title: Retrieve INEI Links of the Basic Cartographic Information — get_inei_link
text: string containing URL requested file.

what: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
text: function downloads latest version geographic data representing various types agricultural areas Peru. details, please visit following page: https://siea.midagri.gob.pe/.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
code: get_midagri_data(layer = NULL, dsn = NULL, show_progress = TRUE, quiet = TRUE)

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
text: layer Character. Specifies layer download. Available layers detailed 'Details' section. dsn Character. output filename .shp .gpkg format. provided, temporary file created. show_progress Logical. TRUE, displays progress bar download. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses informational messages.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
text: `sf` object containing downloaded geographic data.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
text: Available layers : vegetation cover: Polygons representing agricultural areas Peru, produced high-resolution satellite images (RapidEye Sentinel-2). agriculture sector: Polygons representing new national register agricultural statistical sectors year 2024. oil palm: Polygons representing areas cultivated oil palm Peru period 2016 2020. experimental stations: Points representing agricultural experimental stations Peru.

title: Download Geographic Information from MIDAGRI — get_midagri_data
code: # \donttest{ library(geoidep) library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE # Disable the use of S2 geometry for accurate spatial operations sf_use_s2(use_s2 = FALSE) #> Spherical geometry (s2) switched off  # Retrieve the polygon for Coronel Portillo province coronel_portillo <- get_provinces(show_progress = FALSE) |>   subset(NOMBPROV == "CORONEL PORTILLO") |>   st_transform(crs = 32718)  # Download and extract the oil palm layer for Coronel Portillo oil_palm <- get_midagri_data(   layer = "oil palm",   show_progress = FALSE ) |>   st_intersection(coronel_portillo) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries  # Visualize the oil palm layer plot(st_geometry(oil_palm))  # }

what: MIDAGRI links for obtaining cartographic information — get_midagri_link
title: MIDAGRI links for obtaining cartographic information — get_midagri_link
text: MIDAGRI links obtaining cartographic information

title: MIDAGRI links for obtaining cartographic information — get_midagri_link
code: get_midagri_link(type = NULL)

title: MIDAGRI links for obtaining cartographic information — get_midagri_link
text: type string. Select one following layers; 'vegetation cover', 'agriculture sector', 'oil palm'. Defaults NULL.

title: MIDAGRI links for obtaining cartographic information — get_midagri_link
text: string containing URL requested file.
